text:
In the Ant manual, the "Developing with Ant" section, which refers to
several Ant classes, has no pointer or other reference to the API 
documentation.

That section should at least mention that API documentation exists (so one 
knows to look for it), and should say where to find it, ideally with a 
hypertext link.)


Also, note that the on-line Ant documentation (what seems to be available 
from the "Documentation" link on the page at http://jakarta.apache.org/ant/) 
does not contain the API documentation.

It seems that the web site's "Documentation" link is a link to just the
Ant User Manual, not to _all_ of the documentation.  (It should be a link to
a page or directory that reflects the "docs/" directory in the release, so
that it includes the API documentation too.)


P.S.  Who can I write to about the "P2" resolution priority on the bug-entry
form that seems to turn into "high" priority?
creator: Daniel.Barclay@digitalfocus.com

text:
Link added from the table of contents to the API and the API now generated as a
section of the manual.
creator: conor@apache.org
